meanings.sent1: The stoure of the crowded marketplace made it hard to hear.
meanings.sent2: The stoure of the thunderstorm kept everyone indoors.
meanings.sent3: The stoure of the children playing outside was music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: The stoure of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The stoure of the protest echoed through the streets.

meanings.definition: To move or rush with violence or noise
meanings.sent1: The wind began to stoure through the trees, bending them.
meanings.sent2: The waves stoure against the rocky shore, creating a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent3: The kids stoure around the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent4: The car stoured down the highway, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent5: The athletes stoure towards the finish line, giving it their all.

meanings.definition: Dust or debris raised by a commotion
meanings.sent1: The stoure settled on the furniture after the construction work.
meanings.sent2: The stoure from the explosion obscured the view momentarily.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy created a stoure of fur as it rolled around.
meanings.sent4: The stoure of leaves in the autumn breeze was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The stoure of sand from the beach got into everything.
